instructions: In the FaceTime app on your Mac, click All or Missed. If a caller is listed with just a phone number or email address, click the Info button (or use the Touch Bar ), enter the person s info, then click Create. (If a call is labelled with Maybe , click Add To Contacts, then enter the contact details.)

Sign in to your Google Admin console . Sign in using your administrator account (does not end in @gmail.com). From the Admin console Home page, go to Devices . If you don't see Devices on the Home page, at the bottom, click More controls . Choose an option: To block Android, Apple iOS , and Google Sync devices, click Mobile devices . To block devices using endpoint verification, click Endpoint Verification . Locate the device in the list and click its name. Click Block. The device s status changes to Blocked.
To block Android, Apple iOS , and Google Sync devices, click Mobile devices . To block devices using endpoint verification, click Endpoint Verification .

Sign in to your Google Admin console . Sign in using your administrator account (does not end in @gmail.com). From the Admin console Home page, go to Devices . If you don't see Devices on the Home page, at the bottom, click More controls . Choose an option: To unblock Android, iOS, and Google Sync devices, click Mobile devices . To unblock devices using endpoint verification, click Endpoint Verification . Locate the device in the list and click its name. Click Unb lock device. The device s status changes from Blocked to Compliant or Non-compliant, depending on its compliance with your organization s policies.
To unblock Android, iOS, and Google Sync devices, click Mobile devices . To unblock devices using endpoint verification, click Endpoint Verification .

Sign in to your Google Admin console . Sign in using your administrator account (does not end in @gmail.com). From the Admin console Home page, go to Devices . If you don't see Devices on the Home page, at the bottom, click More controls . Choose an option: To delete Android, iOS, and Google Sync devices, click Mobile devices . To delete devices using endpoint verification, click Endpoint Verification . Select the devices you want to delete and click More and then Delete Devices . Deleted devices are removed from the list of managed devices.
To delete Android, iOS, and Google Sync devices, click Mobile devices . To delete devices using endpoint verification, click Endpoint Verification .
